title: language_test_4_9a
prompt: (9) Which of the words is misspelled, if any?
description: Read through this draft of an article about volcanoes. Then go on to the suggestions for revision that follow.
feedback: The correct answer is "leeks." The word "leeks" is misspelled in the sentence and should be spelled "leaks." The sentence should read: “Volcanoes form when magma, molten and semi-molten rock beneath the Earth’s surface, rises and leaks through a rupture in the Earth's crust.” This question asks you to choose the correct commonly confused words. The word “leak” means to accidentally or unusually go through or out of a container. The word “leek” is a kind of vegetable. The correct word is “leak,” since the magma is moving out of the Earth’s containing crust.
